  • Constructor Details

    • AggregateLimitBuilder

      public AggregateLimitBuilder()
      Creates a new AggregateLimitBuilder

  • Method Details

    • uiReadyAggregateLimit

      public static AggregateLimitBuilder uiReadyAggregateLimit()
      Returns a builder to construct a UI ready AggregateLimit. The following fields are set:
      • LimitType: LossDate
      • invalid input: '<'ValueType: Limit/li>
      • invalid input: '<'Amount: 1000.00/li>
      If a policy period is specified via onPolicyPeriod(entity.PolicyPeriod) it will be used, otherwise a new policy period containing a single auto claim will be created and the aggregate limit will be added to that.
      Returns:
      a newly created aggregate limit builder

    • withComments

      public AggregateLimitBuilder withComments(String comments)
      Sets the comments about the aggregate limit.
      Parameters:
      comments - the desired value
      Returns:
      the modified builder

    • withValid

      public AggregateLimitBuilder withValid(boolean valid)
      Sets the valid bit for the aggregate limit.
      Parameters:
      valid - the desired value
      Returns:
      the modified builder

    • withAggLimitCalculationCriteria

      public AggregateLimitBuilder withAggLimitCalculationCriteria(AggLimitCalcCriteria aggLimitCalculationCriteria)
      Sets the AggLimitCalculationCriteria for the aggregate limit. This is a typekey value whose definition should reside in aggregatelimitused-config.xml. That definition would list one or more ExclusionCriteria such that if a transaction met any of those criteria it would be excluded from counting against this aggregate limit. If the definition has no exclusion criteria then the transaction would not be excluded. If this value is not set then transaction would not be excluded.
      Parameters:
      aggLimitCalculationCriteria - the desired value
      Returns:
      the modified builder
      Since:
      CC 8.0

    • withExcludingExpenses

      public AggregateLimitBuilder withExcludingExpenses()
      Sets the AggLimitCalculationCriteria for the aggregate limit to exclude expenses
      Returns:
      the modified builder
      Since:
      CC 8.0

    • withExcludingLegalExpenses

      public AggregateLimitBuilder withExcludingLegalExpenses()

    • onClaimsPolicyPolicyPeriod

      public AggregateLimitBuilder onClaimsPolicyPolicyPeriod(Claim existingClaim)
      Sets the policyPeriod with which the aggregate limit is associated to be the "policy" policy period of the given claim
      Parameters:
      existingClaim - a claim with a policy period with period type "policy"
      Returns:
      the modified builder
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given claim does not have a policy period of type "policy"

    • onClaimsAccountPolicyPeriod

      public AggregateLimitBuilder onClaimsAccountPolicyPeriod(Claim existingClaim)

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the modified builder
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the given claim does not have a policy period of type "account"
